t: Psalm 88
A Prayer for Help in Despondency
A Song. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. To the Chief Musician. Set to “Mahalath Leannoth.” A Contemplation of Heman the Ezrahite.
O*pn Lord,*s God of my salvation, I*ld have cried out day and night before You.
Let*ld my prayer come before You; Incline*ld Your ear to my cry.
For*ln my soul is full of troubles, And*ld my life draws near to the grave.
I*ld am counted with those who go down to the pit; I*ld am like a man who*i has*i no strength,
Adrift*ld among the dead, Like*ld the slain who lie in the grave, Whom*ld You remember no more, And*ld who are cut off from Your hand.
You*ln have laid me in the lowest pit, In*ld darkness, in the depths.
Your*ld wrath lies heavy upon me, And*ld You have afflicted me*i with all Your waves. Selah*ipg
You*ld have put away my acquaintances far from me; You*ld have made me an abomination to them; I*ild am*i shut up, and I cannot get out;
My*ld eye wastes away because of affliction. Lord,*sln I have called daily upon You; I*ld have stretched out my hands to You.
Will*ld You work wonders for the dead? Shall*ld the dead arise and*i praise You? Selah*ipg
Shall*ld Your lovingkindness be declared in the grave? Or*ild Your faithfulness in the place of destruction?
Shall*ld Your wonders be known in the dark? And*ld Your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
But*ln to You I have cried out, O Lord,*s And*ld in the morning my prayer comes before You.
Lord,*sld why do You cast off my soul? Why*ild do You hide Your face from me?
I*ld have*i been*i afflicted and ready to die from my*i youth; I*ld suffer Your terrors; I*ld am distraught.
Your*ld fierce wrath has gone over me; Your*ld terrors have cut me off.
They*ld came around me all day long like water; They*ld engulfed me altogether.
Loved*ld one and friend You have put far from me, And*ild my acquaintances into darkness.
